ygData.subject: Re: Sharpening ... Stone
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, from what I understand (I m not a blacksmith, but have been researching it a bit), you can use blacksmithing skill to get a rusty weapon to tarnished,
ygData.messageBody:
Well, from what I understand (I'm not a blacksmith, but have been
researching it a bit), you can use blacksmithing skill to get a rusty weapon
to tarnished, which will (I believe) decrease the delay, but leave the
damage alone. If your successful in trying, you get a tarnished weapon. If
you fail, you destroy the weapon. The exact procedure, I'm not sure of,
sorry.

I've seen a doc on blacksmithing somewhere on a board that had sharpening of
weapons in it, but I can't find it at the moment. Anyone know where that is?

-Zantaer

-----Original Message-----
From: D Thoma [mailto:milamber@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 3:32 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Sharpening ... Stone


OK, basic question I know, but I have to ask anyway. I have a rusted sword,
how do I get it to good quality again? I would think a sharpening stone. I
guess the question is how do you make a sharpenting stone, or do you obtain
it some place and then how do you apply it? I found the guy I can purchase
ore from and can get a flask of water. I haven't even opened up
blacksmithing yet (will this evening). Can any one give me a little
guidence on the best way to open this skill up other than trial and error.

Thanks for any help

David
